hi and welcome you listening to the x22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1466 am today's date is January
8th 2018 and the top of the episode is
the economy is in the process of being
reworked for the transition let's get
into the economic collapse financial
news now we are headed into a point in
time where it is going to get a lot
worse now I know a lot of people think
that the economy is doing great and I
think the majority of the people in
America right now and maybe globally
they do think the economy of the world
is doing a lot better especially here in
the United States people do believe this
they feel like everything is ok and this
is a very scary moment when people do
believe that things are ok like this
because this is when the central bank's
this is when they pull the carpet out
from under everything and think about
2006 2007 I mean go back on YouTube and
listen to these individuals on the
corporate media and people taking a
equity line of credit and they were
spending money like there was no
tomorrow and I know there's a lot of
money in real estate remember this is
paper money this is it doesn't exist yet
until you sell your home or you take an
equity line of credit out on your house
but you didn't make anything there you
just borrowed against what you've earned
now if your house price goes down why
you'll have this equity line of credit
there's major problems this is what
happened in 2008 a lot of people have
done that also and what the central bank
wants is they want people to take out
these additional loans on their real
estate remember what they've done
they've pumped the real estate market up
in 20 different cities they've did
they've done as much as they possibly
can there's no more that they can do at
this point this is why your see articles
coming out saying there's trillions
locked up in real estate because they
want those people to take equity lines
of credit out on their homes and they
they want you to spend it in retail what
do they get out of this well they get
everyone's spending in retail hopefully
to boost GDP because 70 percent of GDP
is retail they also get more debt think
about this for a second and this is why
they're coming up with those type of
articles but if you're smart and this is
my personal opinion you wouldn't I
wouldn't do that I wouldn't go out and
take a loan out on your paper earnings
that really don't exist yet because you
didn't sell your house now we are seeing
that a lot of retailers they're closing
down shop corporations or laying off
people go pro they were laying off about
250 people of course they're saying they

they don't exist anymore
we know that Regis this is Regis Corp
and they have these smart style salons
inside Walmart they're closing about 600
of these because they're underperforming
and they're restructuring now once again
this means there's not a lot of people
going to these places that's 600 of them
that are closing now what's been
happening here is that people are
feeling good now we've been following
the economy and we know that things are
going south in the economy we've been
looking at the indicators we've been
looking at what's really been going on
and a lot of this what we're seeing
right now duplicates what we've been

pretty much every recession we've seen
especially 2008 we've seen this before
now what we're seeing right now is that
a lot of people won out and they charged
their retail purchases this holiday
season a lot more than they've ever done

where we're seeing that
and this is coming from the Fed data
total consumer debt rose by 28 billion
or the most since November first to
three point eight to seven trillion and

the highest credit card amount

they felt like the economy could never

and what happened everything fell apart
we seen on revolving credit that's auto

eight trillion to two point eight zero
five trillion and what we're seeing

personal savings right now has dropped
by two point nine percent this is the
lowest since November of 2007 it's the
same thing happening once again people

cards they feel everything is going to
be great because they've been told it's

while they're increasing their debt
their savings is declining this is a

Advisors
a property research firm they analyzed
about 950 more locations over 2017 and
what they've been finding is that well
the retail market is a lot worse than we
thought
now out of the 950 more locations 230
are collateralized with in commercial
mortgage-backed securities sound kind of
some similar to the subprime security

here is that these CMBS loans well
they've been packaged and right now this
is a major problem now to put the mall
economic model into perspective Green

the ancillary traffic impact on national

line tenants therefore have an outsized

health with shorter lease terms and

now are making decisions in real time
within each mall the best in line

Green Street says the far more pressing

which stores are quietly shrinking their

roughly 70% of the 950 malls studied
experienced a decrease in national
retailer in line tenants second while
the average amount of net closures
increased materially at lower quality
malls there was a wide dispersion of
neck
closures impacting malls across the
quality spectrum third while half of the
top 25 net closing retailers have
publicly announced store closures
there's something else happening behind
the scenes these are called the quiet

chains that are shrinking their
footprint quietly they're not making big

out there making big announcements and
what we're seeing is Clair's is doing

the body shop papaya and many many

and out of the 950 we have 230 which

back mortgage securities in there sold

once these stores start to default
inside of these securities we have major
major problems now let's throw on top of

putting out

we talked about it before we know that a

degree alternatives do far better than

the balance of the portfolio is nearly
guaranteed to full short of that mark
now the trouble is that we don't have

they're way off there so they're
investing in stocks maybe some of these
more securities which they rated

long-term annual return the index would

which we know it's not it's trading
almost double that so right now there's
a major problem so if the stock market

that opportunity to invest at a level
that would enable them to achieve
anything close to what pensions now

they're screwed anyhow so no matter what

crisis is still a problem
you can't solve it at this point and
people are going to lose out and it's

we have the global debt it has hit our

the IIF this was 327 percent of global

now there's 63 trillion in government

and this tells you that as the debt

there's austerity in countries people

South Korea Switzerland and Turkey now
we understand that this entire economy

they've taken the problem of 2008 and
